title: Dalai Lama accepts first Grammy, after beating out host Trevor Noah
byline: The Dalai Lama is now a Grammy winner, beating out Grammy Awards host Trevor Noah for the coveted award on Sunday, Feb. 1.

title: 230 telemedicine TV screens at risk of damage due to project delays: Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa
byline: More than 230 television screens imported to hospitals across Sri Lanka for telemedicine services are at risk of being damaged, as the project has yet to be implemented, Medical and Civil Rights Doctors’ Trade Union Alliance President Specialist Dr. Chamal Sanjeewa said.

title: Licensed foreign employment agencies to hold peaceful protest seeking ALFEA reforms
byline: Licensed foreign employment agencies have announced a peaceful protest calling for the immediate reform of the Association of Licensed Foreign Employment Agencies (ALFEA), citing long-standing and unresolved governance issues within the organization.

title: Online payment facility introduced for UDA clients
byline: As part of the government’s national drive to digitise public services and strengthen the digital economy, an online payment facility for Urban Development Authority (UDA) clients was officially launched yesterday (February 2) at the Peliyagoda Manning Public Market Complex.

title: Pakistani forces kill 145 fighters in Balochistan after deadly attacks
byline: Pakistani security forces have killed at least 145 fighters in the restive Balochistan province in a manhunt launched after a series of coordinated gun and bomb attacks that left nearly 50 people dead.

title: WCIC raises concern over resignation of National Commission on Women Chairperson
byline: The Women’s Chamber of Industry and Commerce (WCIC) expressed concern over the resignation of Ramani Jayasundara, Chairperson of Sri Lanka’s inaugural National Commission on Women, urging the government to safeguard the progress made on women’s rights and representation.

title: New gazette allows women to work night shifts in hospitality and food sectors
byline: A special Gazette notification has been issued permitting the employment of women over 18 years of age for night work in the hospitality and food service industries, under strict conditions designed to protect their safety, health, and welfare.

title: Over 1,200 US flights canceled as winter storm disrupts travel: Report
byline: Severe winter conditions disrupted transportation and energy systems across the US, grounding more than 1,200 flights and leaving tens of thousands without electricity in multiple states, Bloomberg reported on Sunday.

title: No moves to field Namal as common opposition candidate for Presidential poll 2029: MP
byline: There is no move to field SLPP MP Namal Rajapaksa as the common opposition candidate for the Presidential Election in 2029, an opposition MP said today.

title: Daily Mirror launches Mirror AI, its first AI-powered article summarisation tool
byline: Daily Mirror has announced the launch of Mirror AI, its first artificial intelligence powered article summarisation feature, marking an important step in the publication’s ongoing digital evolution.

title: Lanka Sugar Company denies social media claims about Nugegoda outlet
byline: Lanka Sugar Company (Private) Limited has dismissed recent social media reports regarding its Nugegoda retail outlet, calling the claims false and misleading.

title: GMOA remains stubborn as strike continues
byline: The Government Medical Officers’ Association (GMOA) said its ongoing trade union action will continue after the Health Ministry failed to respond positively to a 48-hour ultimatum that ended on Saturday (31).

title: AG’s Department Legal Officers’ Association condemns unfounded attacks on Attorney General
byline: The Legal Officers’ Association of the Attorney General’s Department has expressed grave concern over the circulation of unfounded and baseless personal attacks directed at Attorney General Parinda Ranasinghe (Jnr), PC, and officers of the Attorney General’s Department in the discharge of their official duties.

title: Exposition of Sacred relics to be conducted around the clock from Wednesday
byline: The exposition of sacred relics of the Buddha brought from the Indian state of Gujarat is to be conducted between February 4 and 11 at the historic Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo.

title: Special traffic plan for exposition of sacred relics at Gangaramaya
byline: A special traffic management and security plan will be implemented in and around the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo in view of the exposition of sacred relics brought from India.

title: Minister Samarasinghe challenged by traders over transfer of management of economic centers
byline: A tense atmosphere prevailed during a conference convened by Minister of Trade and Commerce and Food Security Wasantha Samarasinha to announce the government’s decision to handover the management of five Economic Centers In the Country to the National Agri Marketing Service Company.

title: Govt comes under IMF scrutiny
byline: The International Monetary Fund (IMF ) has queried as to why the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) failed to make submissions to the Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka( PUCSL) for electricity price revision in time, an informed source said yesterday.

title: Dalai Lama accepts first Grammy, after beating out host Trevor Noah
byline: The Dalai Lama is now a Grammy winner, beating out Grammy Awards host Trevor Noah for the coveted award on Sunday, Feb. 1.

title: Court orders CID to arrest Chamal Rajapaksa’s youngest son
byline: The Colombo Fort Magistrate’s Court today ordered the Criminal Investigation Department (CID) to arrest and produce before court Shamindra Rajapaksa, the youngest son of former Speaker Chamal Rajapaksa, in connection with a magisterial inquiry into alleged financial fraud relating to the purchase of 14 Airbus aircraft for Sri Lankan Airlines.

title: Church of Ceylon calls for repeal of PTA, withdrawal of proposed anti-terror bill
byline: The Bishops of the Church of Ceylon have expressed deep concern over the government’s decision to introduce a new anti-terrorism law urging the immediate repeal of the Prevention of Terrorism Act (PTA) and the withdrawal of the proposed Protection of the State from Terrorism Bill (PSTB).

title: Indian tax on animal imports spells setback for billionaire Ambani family’s zoo
byline: India’s budget introduced a customs duty of 30% on imports of animals and birds from Monday, a move set to boost expenses for the nation’s most prominent zoo, run by the family of Asia’s richest man, Mukesh Ambani.

title: SLFEB conducts anti-human trafficking awareness programme for Anuradhapura police
byline: The Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau (SLFEB) has successfully conducted an awareness programme for police officers in the Anuradhapura District focusing on the Anti-Human Trafficking Act, the Sri Lanka Foreign Employment Bureau Act and related investigative procedures.

title: Sri Lankans should strive for full freedom which is yet to be achieved: Cardinal
byline: Sri Lankans should strive for full freedom, which is yet to be achieved through strengthening the rule of law, Archbishop of Colombo Cardinal Malclom Ranjith said today.

title: Residents protest resumption of Kivul Oya project in Vavuniya
byline: A protest was held in Vavuniya against the government’s decision to resume the Kivul Oya Reservoir Development Project, with a large number of residents gathering to voice their opposition.

title: Sheikh Hasina sentenced to 10 years in prison in Bangladesh corruption cases
byline: A special court in Bangladesh on Sunday sentenced former prime minister Sheikh Hasina to a total of 10 years in prison in two separate corruption cases linked to alleged irregularities in the allocation of government land under the Purbachal New Town project.

title: China executes four more Myanmar mafia members
byline: China has executed four members of the Bai family mafia, one of the notorious dynasties that ran scam centres in Myanmar, state media report.

title: Relief measures announced for students affected by disasters under Suraksha Sisu insurance
byline: Relief measures have been introduced for school students affected by recent adverse weather conditions under the Suraksha Sisu Insurance Programme, following a request made by the Education, Higher Education and Vocational Training Ministry.

title: T20 World Cup: ICC warns Pakistan of ‘long-term implications’ of boycotting India match
byline: The International Cricket Council (ICC) on Sunday warned Pakistan of “long-term implications” if they boycotted a Feb. 15 T20 World Cup match against arch-rival India.

title: CEJ warns wetland protection futile amid ongoing development
byline: The Center for Environmental Justice (CEJ) has warned that efforts to protect Sri Lanka’s wetlands are meaningless if development projects continue to destroy them. The statement was made on the occasion of World Wetlands Day, observed annually on 2 February to mark the adoption of the Ramsar Convention on Wetlands in Iran in 1971.

title: G.C.E. (O/L) 2025 (2026) exam to be held from February 17 to 26
byline: The Examinations Department announced that the G.C.E. Ordinary Level Examination – 2025 (2026) will be conducted from February 17 to February 26, 2026, at 3,545 examination centres islandwide.

title: Pope Leo appoints new Vatican Ambassador to Sri Lanka
byline: Pope Leo has appointed Monsignor Andrez Jozwowlez as the new  Apostolic  Nuncio (Vatican Ambassador) of Sri Lanka.

title: Rs. 110 million owed to Hajj operators remains unaccounted for
byline: Hajj operators have alleged that nearly Rs. 110 million, collected additionally from operators for Mina tent facilities during the 2025 Hajj pilgrimage, has yet to be refunded, more than a year after the funds became due for repayment.

title: Special shuttle service for exposition of sacred relics at Gangaramaya
byline: A special shuttle service will be operated for devotees who arrive at the Hunupitiya Gangaramaya Temple in Colombo for the exposition of the sacred relics brought from India.

title: Colombo market opens week lower amid mixed investor sentiment
byline: The Colombo stock market began the week on a subdued note on Monday (2nd February 2026), as key indices fell sharply during the session.

title: Starlink assisted digitalization for UNP
byline: The United National Party (UNP) is to embark on a mission to digitalize the party activities with a special digitalized process assisted by Starlink, Party General Secretary Harin Fernando said today.

title: Suspended Parliament Deputy SG complains to Bribery Commission against Speaker
byline: Former Deputy Secretary General of Parliament Chaminda Kularatne, who was suspended, lodged a complaint with the Bribery Commission today against Speaker Jagath Wickramaratne.

title: Businessman arrested at BIA with undeclared foreign currency worth Rs. 22.4 million
byline: A Sri Lankan air passenger who allegedly attempted to illegally bring into the country and remove a stock of foreign currency valued at over Rs. 22.4 million through the “Green Channel” at the arrival terminal of the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA), Katunayake, was arrested by airport Customs officers on the morning of February 2.

title: 49 prisoners to benefit from special Presidential pardon for Independence Day
byline: A total of 49 prisoners are eligible to benefit from a special Presidential Pardon, which will take effect on February 4, 2026, in view of the 78th National Independence Day, Prisons Commissioner (Media Spokesperson) A.C. Gajanayake said.

title: Over 2,000 Thai tourists arrive at Hambantota Port
byline: A group of 2,117 tourists arrived from Thailand by sea at Hambantota International Port today.

title: Sri Lanka Men’s squad announced for T20 World Cup
byline: The Sri Lanka Cricket Selection Panel has selected a 15-member Sri Lanka Men’s squad for the ICC Men’s T20 World Cup 2026.

title: India to send sacred Devnimori Relics of Lord Buddha to Sri Lanka for historic exposition
byline: In a continuation of the vision articulated by the Prime Minister of India during his visit to Sri Lanka in April 2025, India is set to undertake a profound gesture of spiritual outreach and cultural diplomacy through the exposition of the sacred Devnimori Relics of Lord Buddha in Sri Lanka.
